item.name: Chainsaw
item.comment: The chainsaw was a poor choice, amateur archaeologist. It destroyed your dig site.

item.name: Shaker screen
item.comment: The shaker screen will be a great help in finding little artifacts in the sand and dirt.

item.name: Trowel
item.comment: A trowel is an excellent choice. Archaeologists live and die by the success of their troweling.

item.name: Tire buckets
item.comment: Tire buckets aren’t the best-looking tools, but they’re incredibly handy at a work site.

item.name: Dynamite
item.comment: Dynamite? Are you nuts? You just blew up all the artifacts!

item.name: Blow dryer
item.comment: A blow dryer might make you the best-looking archaeologist in Egypt, but it’s not going to find much for you.

item.name: Gophers
item.comment: Gophers aren’t native to Egypt. You risk ruining the natural environment. Plus, the little fellers are really hard to train.

item.name: Camera
item.comment: A camera is a good choice. You’ll want to record things just as you found them.

item.name: Laptop computer
item.comment: Laptop computers are essential nowadays. Make sure you keep the blowing sand from getting into the keyboard.

item.name: Air conditioner
item.comment: An air conditioner will suck all the juice out of the generator. There are cheaper, easier ways to keep cool.

item.name: Television
item.comment: TV is a waste of good digging time. Digging season is short—you need to make every minute count.

item.name: DVD player
item.comment: Leave the DVD player at home. You’ll be too busy working. Besides, Netflix and Blockbuster don’t reach the remote areas of Egypt.

item.name: Generator
item.comment: A generator is a good investment for a successful mission. You’re going to need electricity to power your computers and other gear.

item.name: Sand bags
item.comment: Sand bags can help keep your dig walls from collapsing.

item.name: Flip-flops
item.comment: Flip-flops are a bad choice. Working on an archaeology dig is not a day at the beach.

item.name: Hamburgers
item.comment: Hamburgers are a poor food choice. A lot of that meat is going to spoil in the heat.

item.name: Macaroni
item.comment: Macaroni is a good selection. You can get a lot of food out of macaroni just by boiling it in water.

item.name: Hot dogs
item.comment: Hot dogs will spoil long before you’re done with your dig.

item.name: Ice cream
item.comment: Hey Einstein, ice cream is not going to last too long in the desert. Try picking some food that’s going to hold up in the heat.

item.name: Instant mashed potatoes
item.comment: Instant mashed potatoes are a good selection. Dry foods keep well in the desert.

item.name: Pizza
item.comment: Pizza might be tasty, but the ingredients won’t last long in the dry desert air.

item.name: Soup
item.comment: Soup is a good food choice. Just add water and you’ve got a full meal.

item.name: Shorts
item.comment: Wearing shorts while digging will beat up your legs.
